metadata.title: CVE-2017-11464 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A SIGFPE is raised in the function box_blur_line of rsvg-filter.c in GNOMElibrsvg 2.40.17 during an attempted parse of a crafted SVG file, because ofincorrect protection against division by zero.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-rsvg-2.0 - 2.40.18-1
librsvg2-2 - 2.40.18-1
librsvg2-bin - 2.40.18-1
librsvg2-common - 2.40.18-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: librsvg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.40.18-1').
